texts.value: Inhibits the integrated stress response (ISR) in the infected cell by preventing the sequestration of eIF2B by phosphorylated EIF2S1/eIF-2alpha (PubMed:32690955). Stress granule formation in response to EIF2S1/eIF-2alpha phosphorylation is thus inhibited, which allows protein synthesis and viral replication (PubMed:32690955). Does not have any proteolytic activity (PubMed:14512530). Required for viral RNA replication and viral RNA encapsidation (PubMed:14512530)

Forms an icosahedral capsid of pseudo T=3 symmetry with capsid proteins VP0 and VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Together they form an icosahedral capsid composed of 60 copies of each VP0, VP1, and VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). All the three latter proteins contain a beta-sheet structure called beta-barrel jelly roll (PubMed:27595320)

Forms an icosahedral capsid of pseudo T=3 symmetry with capsid proteins VP1 and VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Together they form an icosahedral capsid composed of 60 copies of each VP0, VP1, and VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). All the three latter proteins contain a beta-sheet structure called beta-barrel jelly roll (PubMed:27595320)

Forms an icosahedral capsid of pseudo T=3 symmetry with capsid proteins VP0 and VP1 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Together they form an icosahedral capsid composed of 60 copies of each VP0, VP1, and VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). All the three latter proteins contain a beta-sheet structure called beta-barrel jelly roll (PubMed:27595320)
Required for viral RNA replication (PubMed:18653460). Does not have any proteolytic activity (PubMed:18653460)
Affects membrane integrity and causes an increase in membrane permeability

Induces and associates with structural rearrangements of intracellular membranes. Displays RNA-binding, nucleotide binding and NTPase activities. May play a role in virion morphogenesis and viral RNA encapsidation by interacting with the capsid protein VP3

Serves as membrane anchor via its hydrophobic domain. Plays an essential role in viral RNA replication by recruiting PI4KB at the viral replication sites, thereby allowing the formation of the rearranged membranous structures where viral replication takes place (PubMed:22124328, PubMed:24672044, PubMed:27989622, PubMed:30755512, PubMed:22258260). Stimulates the enzymatic activity of PI4KB, this activation is sensitized by ACBD3 (PubMed:24672044, PubMed:27989622)
Forms a primer, VPg-pU, which is utilized by the polymerase for the initiation of RNA chains

Cysteine protease that generates mature viral proteins from the precursor polyprotein (By similarity). In addition to its proteolytic activity, it binds to viral RNA, and thus influences viral genome replication. RNA and substrate cooperatively bind to the protease (By similarity)
Replicates the genomic and antigenomic RNAs by recognizing replications specific signals (By similarity). Performs VPg uridylylation (By similarity)

reaction.name: Selective cleavage of Gln-|-Gly bond in the poliovirus polyprotein. In other picornavirus reactions Glu may be substituted for Gln, and Ser or Thr for Gly.

texts.value: Interacts with host eIF-2B; this interaction disrupts the interaction between eIF2 and eIF-2B, which leads to the inhibition of stress granules formation
Interacts with capsid protein VP1 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Interacts with capsid protein VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320)
Interacts with capsid protein VP0 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Interacts with capsid protein VP3 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320)
Interacts with capsid protein VP0 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320). Interacts with capsid protein VP1 (PubMed:27681122, PubMed:27595320)
Homodimer (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with protein 2B (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with protein 2C (PubMed:19879907)
Homodimer (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with host ABCD3 (PubMed:22124328). Interacts with protein 2A (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with host ACBD3 (PubMed:22124328)

Homodimer (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with host ABCD3 (PubMed:22124328). Interacts with protein 2A (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with protein 3A (PubMed:22124328). Interacts with protein 3C (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with host ACBD3 (PubMed:22124328)

Homodimer (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with host ABCD3 (via GOLD domain) and PI4KB; these interactions allow the formation of a viral protein/ACBD3/PI4KB complex in order to synthesize PI4P at the viral RNA replication sites (PubMed:22124328, PubMed:22258260, PubMed:24672044, PubMed:27989622, PubMed:30755512, PubMed:28065508) (Probable). Interacts with protein 2C (PubMed:19879907). Interacts with protein 3C (PubMed:19879907). Protein 3C: Interacts with protein 2A (PubMed:19879907). Protein 3C: Interacts with protein 2C (PubMed:19879907)

Probably localizes to the surface of intracellular membrane vesicles that are induced after virus infection as the site for viral RNA replication. These vesicles are probably autophagosome-like vesicles

Probably localizes to the surface of intracellular membrane vesicles that are induced after virus infection as the site for viral RNA replication. These vesicles are probably autophagosome-like vesicles
Probably localizes to intracellular membrane vesicles that are induced after virus infection as the site for viral RNA replication

Probably localizes to the surface of intracellular membrane vesicles that are induced after virus infection as the site for viral RNA replication. These vesicles are probably autophagosome-like vesicles

Specific enzymatic cleavages by the viral protease in vivo yield a variety of precursors and mature proteins (PubMed:22226945). The leader protein-VP0 junction is cleaved by 3C proteinase (PubMed:14512530). The VP1/2A junction is cleaved by the protein 3CD in association with protein 2A (PubMed:22226945)
Uridylylated by the polymerase and is covalently linked to the 5'-end of genomic RNA. This uridylylated form acts as a nucleotide-peptide primer for the polymerase

features.description: Involved in the inhibition of host stress granule formation
Involved in the inhibition of host stress granule formation
Complete loss of inhibition of host stress granule formation leading to translation shutoff in the host cell; when associated with A-56.
Complete loss of binding to host eIF2B. Complete loss of inhibition of host stress granule formation leading to translation shutoff in the host cell; when associated with A-53.
Complete loss of proteolytic cleavage between the leader protein and VP1 protein.
Complete loss of interaction between the 3C-3D precursor and protein 2A.
No effect on the interaction between the 3C-3D precursor and protein 2A.
Complete loss of myristoylation; loss of interaction with host ACBD3. Loss of activation of host PI4KB in vitro.
Loss of interaction with host ACBD3 and PI4KB.
Loss of activation of host PI4KB in vitro.
Complete loss of cleavage at the 3C-3D junction.

keywords.name: Eukaryotic host gene expression shutoff by virus

citation.title: Complete nucleotide sequence and genetic organization of Aichi virus, a distinct member of the Picornaviridae associated with acute gastroenteritis in humans.
Construction of an infectious cDNA clone of Aichi virus (a new member of the family Picornaviridae) and mutational analysis of a stem-loop structure at the 5' end of the genome.
Aichi virus leader protein is involved in viral RNA replication and encapsidation.
Aichi virus 2A protein is involved in viral RNA replication.
Overall linkage map of the nonstructural proteins of Aichi virus.
3CD, but not 3C, cleaves the VP1/2A site efficiently during Aichi virus polyprotein processing through interaction with 2A.
ACBD3-mediated recruitment of PI4KB to picornavirus RNA replication sites.
The 3A protein from multiple picornaviruses utilizes the golgi adaptor protein ACBD3 to recruit PI4KIIIbeta.

referencePositions: MUTAGENESIS OF GLY-1653; ASN-1654; ARG-1655 AND ILE-1657

citation.title: ACBD3 interaction with TBC1 domain 22 protein is differentially affected by enteroviral and kobuviral 3A protein binding.

A complex comprising phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase IIIbeta, ACBD3, and Aichi virus proteins enhances phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate synthesis and is critical for formation of the viral replication complex.
The molecular basis of Aichi virus 3A protein activation of phosphatidylinositol 4 kinase IIIbeta, PI4KB, through ACBD3.
ACBD3 is an essential pan-enterovirus host factor that mediates the interaction between viral 3A protein and cellular protein PI4KB.
Inhibition of the integrated stress response by viral proteins that block p-eIF2-eIF2B association.
Move and countermove: the integrated stress response in picorna- and coronavirus-infected cells.
The use of noncrystallographic symmetry averaging to solve structures from data affected by perfect hemihedral twinning.
